Column Comment.0: EQUIPMENT CATALOGUE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the list of kinds ofequipment. Think of this as a catalogue or brochure that shows all the kinds ofequipment that you may use, but may or may not actually have. Actual pieces ofequipment that exist are defined in the table EQUIPMENT.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: CATALOGUE EQUIPMENT GROUP: The functional group of equipment types, suchas vehicles, drilling rigs, measuring equipment, monitoring equipment etc. Note thatthe function of this table may also be assumed by the CLASSIFICATION module formore robust and complete classifications.
Column Comment.3: CATALOGUE EQUIPMENT TYPE: the type of equipment that is listed, can begrouped into broad classifications with R CAT EQUIP GROUP if you wish. Note thatthe function of this table may also be assumed by the CLASSIFICATION module formore robust and complete classifications.
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.5: EQUIPMENT NAME: the name given to this type of equipment.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.7: TYPICAL EQUIPMENT INSTALLATION TYPE: Indicates where this type ofequipment would normally be used, such as on the drilling assembly, in the well bore,on well site, on rig, in processing facility.
Column Comment.8: MANUFACTURER: the unique identifier for the business associate whomanufactures this kind of equipment.
Column Comment.9: MODEL NUMBER: The model number assigned to this kind of equipment.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.12: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
